MONARCHY.Definition: a form of government with a king or queen at its head

DICTATORSHIP.Definition: a form of government with a ruler who took control by force

COURSE.Definition: the way in which something progresses

SCRATCHING YOUR HEAD.Definition: thinking hard trying to solve a puzzle

SUPERFICIAL.Definition: existing on the surface, not deep

SOUNDBITES.Definition: short phrases that are easy to remember

FEUDAL.Definition: according to a system which gave power to the upper class (nobles), but made life difficult for the working class (vassals)

PYRAMID.Definition: a system that is made with fewer people at its level as one approaches the top

ARISTOCRATS.Definition: people belonging to the highest class in certain societies and having titles and offices, passed from generation to generation

HARVESTS.Definition: the quantity of crops (plants grown to be used as food) gathered

SYMPATHY.Definition: feeling of understanding, support and compassion

PREJUDICE.Definition: an unfair opinion about someone, especially when formed without thought or knowledge

SNAP HIS FINGERS.Definition: make a sudden decision and expect everyone to follow it

CLERGY.Definition: people performing religious activities and services

NOBILITY.Definition: the highest class in certain societies

COMMONERS.Definition: the social class of ordinary, common people

VETO.Definition: an official right to refuse to accept something

VOTE DOWN.Definition: to refuse to accept something by voting

LEGISLATION.Definition: a set of laws according to which a state is governed

CONSTITUTION.Definition: the system of laws which states people's rights and duties

RELENTED.Definition: became less strict, allowed something he had refused before

EYEWITNESS.Definition: a person who saw something happen

ARISTOCRATIC.Definition: related to people who belong to the highest class

CONSPIRACY.Definition: the act of secretly planning with other people to do something bad

CRACK DOWN.Definition: become stricter in making them obey

LANDOWNERS.Definition: people who own large amounts of land

COMPATIBLE.Definition: able to exist together without problems

FLEE.Definition: escape something due to being dangerous

COUNTER-REVOLUTION.Definition: a revolution against the previous uprising

TRAPPED.Definition: in a position from which it's difficult to escape

SPREAD.Definition: spread the word, make known in a wide area

EXECUTED.Definition: killed as someone who is sentenced to death

HIGH TREASON.Definition: the crime of acting against one's country

BETRAYING.Definition: doing something harmful to your country

GUILLOTINE.Definition: a machine used in the past for killing criminals by cutting off their heads

MET THE SAME FATE.Definition: had the same thing happen to her

ATTRIBUTED.Definition: is considered to have been said by

LUXURY.Definition: expensive, not necessary and very enjoyable

OUT OF TOUCH.Definition: in a state of not knowing what was happening

PRESUMABLY.Definition: very likely but not said with certainty

CART.Definition: an open vehicle that was used in the past

NOBLE.Definition: belonging in the highest society class

IDEOLOGICAL.Definition: related to a system of ideas and ideals

FACTION.Definition: a small group within a larger one

COUNTER-REVOLUTIONARY.Definition: related to a revolution against the previous uprising

RISING THROUGH THE RANKS.Definition: continuing moving to more important positions

DECISIVE.Definition: that provided a particular result, important

FURTHER AFIELD.Definition: in areas other than the nearest ones

MONARCH.Definition: absolute ruler, a king or queen

CONSTITUTIONAL.Definition: related to the system of laws which states people's rights and duties

DECAPITATE.Definition: cut off the head of someone

SUBJECTS.Definition: people living under the rule of a monarch

COLONIAL.Definition: related to the practice of one country controlling another one

UNITY.Definition: the state of being in agreement

BROTHERHOOD.Definition: the feeling of companionship and togetherness

MOTTO.Definition: a short phrase that expresses a belief

ARISTOCRACY.Definition: a class of people who belong to a high social rank

NOBLES.Definition: people belonging to the highest class in certain societies

ANCESTORS.Definition: persons that are related to someone but lived a long time ago

BALANCE.Definition: considering the importance in comparison to something else

FOOLISHNESS.Definition: lack of good sense or judgement

INCREDULITY.Definition: the state of being unable to believe something

INSPIRED.Definition: filled someone with the will and ability to do something
